summary: PHP 8 named arguments are incorrectly handled when calling workflow handlers, causing parameters to be passed in the wrong order. When using named arguments like `handler(bar: true)`, the SDK sends all skipped default values instead of properly mapping named arguments to their corresponding parameters.
userImpact: Users cannot reliably use PHP 8 named arguments when calling workflow handlers, forcing them to use positional arguments or risk unexpected behavior.
rootCause: The SDK's parameter packing mechanism does not properly handle PHP 8 named arguments, instead treating them as positional and including all default values for skipped parameters.
workaround: Use positional arguments instead of named arguments when calling workflow handlers.
resolutionDetails: Named arguments are not supported due to limited language support across Temporal SDKs.
keyQuote: Named arguments are not allowed due to limited language support.
